description: Product of all divisors of n, divided by product of unitary divisors; or equivalently product of non-unitary divisors of n.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
example: n=16 and only {1,16} are unitary, while {2,4,8} are non-unitary divisors, so a(16)=64. When all divisors are unitary, then A048105 is 0 and corresponding terms here are equal to 1.
prog: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, s=divisors(n); a=1; for (i=2, length(s), d=s[i]; if (gcd(d, n/d)!=1, a*=d)); write("b061538.txt", n, " ", a) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 24 2009]
author: _Labos Elemer_, May 15 2001
extensions: Corrected and edited by _Jaroslav Krizek_, Mar 05 2009
